article: As a mother, I have been blessed. I have a nice, smart, good-looking son named Alan. About a month ago, there was an assembly about seat belt safety _ at Alan's high school. One of the presenters in this program, Kathy Hezlep, had _ her son in a horrible car crash the year before. When Kathy was _ asked to speak at this assembly, she was reluctant . Her son's _ had been extremely hard on her. She often felt helpless and discouraged, and she wasn't sure how she could _ a difference by speaking to this group. But at last she _ to talk to the students in the school. Kathy spoke about how _ it had been since the loss of her son. She spoke _ from her heart and _ son took her words straight into his heart. One day, the worst nightmare came. The _ told me my son had been driving down a curving road and lost _ of the car. When I was taken to the scene of the accident and saw the broken car, I felt physically _ . I couldn't _ three kids had walked away from that car _ . When I got to the hospital, I talked to Alan about the accident. He told me that _ of the kids had been _ their seat belts when he started the car. But Kathy's words about her terrible loss had _ him so deeply that he _ that everyone put on their shoulder and lap belts before he would leave. That is _ had saved their lives.
